data.title: Not That Impressed!
data.text:
Had a late dinner here with a large party (20-25) people. We were there to celebrate a graduation. First one has to assume that with a group this size the service will be somewhat on the slow side. That's not my reason for this review. Based on my order and some of the items that others ordered it just seems to me that the food was overpriced ($7) for a clump of greasy fried okra, oh yea it had a small container of ranch dressing.
I had the smoked wings, they were good. My wife had what looked like a childs plate, very small portion for the price. Just not that impressed.

data.title: Great Location, Great Food
data.text: We ate here on a beautiful Sunday while we were on a college visit to UNC Chapel Hill.  The food was absolutely delicious!  Service was great as well!

data.title: Still serving great pub food and drink
data.text: Stopped in for dinner on a return to campus for the first time in a decade and Spanky's was solid.  Great burgers and fries and other classic bar food available too.  We ordered the chips and the guacamole was surprisingly good to a Californian. Kinda liked the piemento cheese too.  They had some great beers on tap including a local amber I had twice.  Great location and people watching out the window.

data.title: Great location....tasty food
data.text: Went here for lunch and was really impressed with the decor, location, staff and food. Franklin Street is such a fun place to be and people watch. Spanky's is right on the corner and if you score a window seat, you can enjoy watching the world go by while dining on some tasty treats. My husband started off with the Brunswick stew- great flavors, tender meat with a little kick. I started with a side of mac and cheese. Enjoyed the little skillet it came in- kept the mac and cheese warm thru the entire meal. The chili burger was delicious- tasty chili with a well cooked burger on a fresh roll. I had the AVT sandwich which was a avocado and pimento cheese with greens and tomato on grilled bread. It was fantastic! A wonderful blend of flavors- I would certainly order this sandwich the next time we return. Waitstaff was very attentive and we really enjoyed our time. Check out Spanky's- you wont be disappointed.

data.title: chapel hill classic
data.text: we have always had great meals and service at spanky's. The food is very good and reasonably priced. Gets crazy and loud as the night goes on.

data.title: Friendly
data.text: Spanky's is one of the restaurants in Downtown Chapel Hill . The service was very friendly and the food was great as well. The menu is rather casual with burgers and such. I really enjoyed my burger and will dine here again.

data.title: Downtown Chapel Hill
data.text: Right in the middle of Chapel Hill.  Collegiate atmosphere and food.  Food is well prepared and the staff is always friendly

data.title: Very nice cheesecake
data.text: Walked in for a drink after eating a meal across the road. Immediately wished I'd eaten here instead. Bar staff were friendly and chatty and strawberry cheesecake was lovely

data.title: Nice restaurant with old time tavern feel
data.text: We had a nice dinner here while in the area.  The restaurant reminds me of an Irish pub with all the nice dark wood work.  The food and service was good!  Recommend them for lunch or dinner while in the area.

data.title: Summer
data.text: We had lunch there after visiting UNC it's just down the road, friendly service, busy clean and great choice of food, and nice fresh clean bathrooms !

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Stopped in for lunch and it was great. The service was fantastic but the burger was amazing! I liked sitting on the 2nd floor and looking outside at the campus and people. Would go back next time I'm in town.

data.title: Pleasant meal but understaffed
data.text: Came in for dinner and they were swamped. The food was very good. The restaurant was clean and inviting. The service was lacking. It wasn't due to our server not trying they were just understaffed. It was the summer and school was out,  that may have been the reason. I would give them another chance if we were back in the area.

data.title: Menu variety, Pleasant Atmophere
data.text: We recently enjoyed a family meal at Spanky's. The server quickly rearranged tables and chairs to accommodate our group of 6.  The menu included a variety of options, including a huge portion of mac and cheese from the children's menu for our youngest. The grilled veggie gyro was delicious, as was the house specialty citrus-ade. I would definitely return.

data.title: A Chapel Hill fixture
data.text: This restaurant is good for a quick meal before a concert or game on campus and has full menu. One can have a snack, enjoy a beer or the menu has full dinners

data.title: Food was OK, Service was Terrible
data.text: I met a friend here because I heard it was an awesome restaurant.  I was extremely disappointed with the service.  I believe we saw the water to order our drinks, food, and had to chase him down to pay the bill or get drink refills.  simply terrible.  Food was okay, nothing spectacular but not terrible either.

data.title: A sad change for the worse
data.text:
Spanky's used to be a pleasant place to grab a bite in downtown Chapel Hill. The food was better than OK. Recently, however, they have remade themselves as a "Southern barbecue" place. This was a seriously bad idea. 
First of all, they're in North Carolina, a place with a proud and distinctive barbecue tradition, but they ignore it completely, offering all sorts of meats, slathered with a Kansas City-style sauce that disguises the taste of the meat completely. Actually, though, this isn't a bad idea, since the meat is poorly cooked and seemingly untouched by wood smoke (thus, not really barbecue at all).
I gave the place two stars instead of one only because it is a Chapel Hill institution. On the basis of the food alone, it no longer deserves to exist. If it's not too late, they should forget the "barbecue" and bring back the club sandwich.

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: One of our favorite spots when we visit. Fantastic burgers and a great selection of local brews. An institution that hopefully will survive for many more years.

data.title: Great spot with good service
data.text: Nice food and good beers with very good attentive service.  We ate upstairs in a big group and staff couldn't be more helpful.

data.title: Frequent When in Chapel Hill
data.text: My husband and I tend to go to Spanky's whenever we are in Chapel Hill for lunch.  A Chapel Hill institution, they have great burgers and sandwiches and if you get lucky to sit near the window you can people watch those walking down Franklin Street.  Recommeded for lunch.

data.title: Started of good but No!
data.text: Ate dinner at Spanky's last night and it was soooo disappointing. We started off with an amazing appetizer "veggie nachos""  and it was delicious but then it all quickly slid downhill will the entrées. I had a BBQ platter, that consisted of sour pulled pork and gummy over cooked corn bread the other entree was shrimp and grits and the only way to describe that was totally bland and tasteless, what a shame..we had high hopes.
